title: ISic000697. Fragment of a Latin text containing numerals
body:
1[---].CC[---]
2[---] ex · [---]
3[---]X̣XIIII [---]

1[---]·CC[---]
2[---]EX·[---]
3[---].XIIII[---]

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text controlled against photograph;
  • 1: Manganaro: [- - ex test. HS]CC [- m.n. - ]; lapis: CO theoretically possible, but the close proximity of the characters suggests a numeral; lapis: the tail of the preceding character is visible on the stone, and is compatible with the foot of a diagonal stroke, most likely M therefore (since XCC is unlikely), assuming part of the numeral.
  • 2: Manganaro: [ut - - ]ex [usuris? -]; lapis: traces of serif perhaps lower right after interpunct.
  • 3: Manganaro: [?die natali distributio] XXIIII [- -]; lapis: space after final vertical.

translation

commentary

Manganaro offers an entirely exempli gratia restoration following IlS 6468, suggesting it might be concerned with financial arrangements for funerary celebrations; but other interpretations are possible. The fragment was omitted from L'Annee Epigraphique 1989 no.339.

bibliography

  • Manganaro 1989 166 no. 27 fig. 27 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001831
Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence.
